1.label: Motion detection - sensitivity
1.description: The lower the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor.

2.label: Motion detection - blind time
2.description: Period of time through which the PIR sensor is “blind”.

3.label: Motion detection - pulse counter
3.description: Sets the number of moves required for the PIR sensor to report motion.

4.label: Motion detection - window time
4.description: The higher the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor.

6.label: Motion detection - alarm cancellation delay
6.description: Period of time after wich Motion alarm will be cancelled.

8.label: Motion detection - operating mode
8.description: The parameter determines the part of day in which the PIR sensor will be active.

options.label: PIR sensor active during the day only
PIR sensor active during the night only

9.label: Motion detection - night/day
9.description: The parameter defines the difference between night and day.

12.label: BASIC command class configuration
12.description: Determines the command frames sent in 2nd association group.

14.label: BASIC ON command frame value
14.description: The value of 255 allows to turn ON a device.

16.label: BASIC OFF command frame value
16.description: The value of 0 allows to turn OFF a device.

18.label: Associations in Z-Wave network Security Mode
18.description: This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups

20.label: Tamper - sensitivity
20.description: Change in force that will result in tamper alarm

22.label: Tamper - alarm cancellation delay
22.description: Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled.

24.label: Tamper - operating modes
24.description: This parameter determines function of the tamper and sent reports

25.label: Tamper - alarm cancellation
25.description: This parameter allows to disable cancellation of the tamper alarm.

options.label: Do not send tamper cancellation report

28.label: Tamper - broadcast mode
28.description: Determines whether the tamper alarm frame will be sent in broadcast mode

options.label: Reported in broadcast mode to 3rd assoc grp

29.label: Tamper - backward compatible broadcast mode
29.description: Determines whether the tamper alarm frame will be sent in broadcast mode

options.label: Reported in broadcast mode to 5th assoc grp

40.label: Illuminance report - threshold
40.description: Change in light intensity level resulting in illumination report

42.label: Illuminance report - interval
42.description: Time interval between consecutive illumination reports

60.label: Temperature report - threshold
60.description: The change in temperature resulting in temperature report

62.label: Temperature measuring - interval
62.description: How often the temperature will be measured

64.label: Temperature report - interval
64.description: How often the temperature reports will be sent

66.label: Temperature offset
66.description: Value added to the actual temperature

82.label: LED - illuminance for low indicator brightness
82.description: Light intensity level below which brightness of visual indicator is set to 1%.

83.label: LED - illuminance for high indicator brightness
83.description: Light intensity level above which brightness of visual indicator is set to 100%.

86.label: LED - temperature for blue colour
86.description: Minimum temperature resulting in blue LED illumination

87.label: LED - temperature for red colour
87.description: Minimum temperature resulting in red LED illumination

89.label: LED - tamper alarm
89.description: Indicating mode resembles a police car (white, red and blue

options.label: LED does not indicate tamper alarm.
